dcterms:creator: L. Stoia
dcterms:description: The SCARE corpus consists of fifteen English spontaneous dialogues situated in an instruction giving task, collected using the QUAKE environment, a first-person virtual reality game. The dialogues vary in length, with a minimum of 400 turns and a maximum of 1500, and include audio, video, and word-aligned transcriptions.
dcterms:title: SCARE corpus

dcterms:creator: K. Rodríguez
D. Schlangen
dcterms:description: The Bielefeld corpus consists of dialogues in which one participant gives instructions in German to the other to build a model plane. The interactions occur face to face, and the corpus includes 22 dialogues with an average of 180 turns each.
dcterms:title: Bielefeld corpus

dcterms:creator: C. L. Bennett
A. I. Rudnicky
dcterms:description: The Carnegie Mellon Communicator Corpus consists of travel reservation dialogues between a client and a travel agent, occurring by phone without a shared view of the task. The corpus includes 31 dialogues with an average of 67 turns each.
dcterms:title: Carnegie Mellon Communicator Corpus

dcterms:creator: M. Purver
dcterms:description: The BNC corpus contains English dialogue transcriptions of topics of general interest in multiparty dialogue such as meetings. The corpus has been annotated for clarification requests and includes over 10,000 turns.
dcterms:title: BNC corpus
